properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:18AM CST until February 21 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Kentucky...Illinois...

Ohio River at Owensboro...Newburgh Dam...Evansville...Mount Vernon...
J.T. Myers Dam...Shawneetown and Golconda

. Minor flooding continues from Owensboro to Golconda. Moderate flooding
is still forecast to begin later today at Shawneetown and persist through
Sunday. River levels at Newburgh Dam and Evansville are cresting at this
time, but remainder of the river locations are on the rise. The river at
Owensboro and Evansville will fall below flood stage late this week, but
most river locations will not fall below flood stage until early next week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River at Owensboro.
* until Friday afternoon.
* At  4:17 AM Monday the stage was 42.3 feet.
* Flood Stage is 40.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 42.5 feet
late this afternoon, then slowly fall. The river will fall
below flood stage late Friday morning. February 21.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
